translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Opposite of Ideas

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽9.2. Hetuduka, Vedanāttika🔽Nahetuṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya        na hetum na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetum na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma
translated: The Chapter on the Three Times🔽With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state prompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. (Abbreviated.)

original: paṭicca nanahetu nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava. (Sabbattha nava.)🔽Nahetuṁ nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭicca na na hetu na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha nava  na hetum na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state prompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with painful feeling … With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with pleasant feeling … With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and prompted by a root arises conditionally. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha nava
translated: With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state prompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling arises conditionally. With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprompted by a root and associated with painful feeling … With a condition being a state unprompted by a root and associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling, a state unprom

original: Nahetuṁ naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-cause that is related to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as condition there arises a non-cause that is related to neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. (In brief.)

analyzed: hetuyā nava pe avigate nava sabbattha nava
translated: With a cause there are nine … With an effect there are nine … With an outcome there are nine … With a sign there are nine … With a condition there are nine. (In all cases nine.)
